author: Tai Ch
comment: It doesnt work with my LG urbane. Dont waste your time. Their website Moveup.zone have virus dangerous site warning  mcafee. Stay away from this apps.
title: It doesnt work

author: Rick Kennis
comment: It's ok. Paid for premium, but can't make custom inactive time. After selecting time, there's only a cancel button and no submit or accept button. Whoops.

author: Divya Mascarenhas
comment: It doesnt work with fossil q wander

author: Amarpreet Doal
comment: It didn't work as intended with my Huawei smart watch, but they provided a prompt refund for premium.

author: Daniel Fedeles
comment: I whant my money back.

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content: Sorry, we are unable to identify your purchase based on review only. Please contact us via email and send us your transaction id. Thank you.

author: Wellington Amaral
comment: I setup the app for 11a-8p, but it never starts up on its own. I have to start the app manually every day. Wasn't the automatic startup the premium feature that I paid for? (Gear Live smartwatch and Galaxy S5 phone)
title: Never starts on its own

author: Emma Beviss
comment: I had to review this as there only seems to be negative comments. The free version works like a dream for my Asus ZenWatch. If it continues to function well and doesn't drain my battery too much I will definitely buy premium.

author: Aaron Anselment
comment: I really wanted to love this app since it claims to do exactly what I was looking for. Unfortunately it does not seem to work very well on my Moto360 sport. Notifications will not go off until I manually wake the watch, and several times I've been notified that I haven't moved in over an hour when I had just sat back down from a walk. Beyond all that, it uses about 10 times as much battery as my next most draining app.

author: Sharon Snyder
comment: I have not been able to get it to save the settings for days of week or times to monitor.
title: Doesn't save settings or autostart

author: Robert Capezzuto
comment: i figured an app like this would have a permanent card on my watch, a gear live running wear 1.5.0, but as soon as my watch screen goes off, the now card disappears and i have to start the app over again. i just got it and hope an update or two might fix it, but for now i'll put up with it
title: the card doesn't stay on my watch

author: Brittany Joseph
comment: This app is a great idea but it won't download on to my watch. Does anyone know the reason for this or a way around it?
title: Moto360 v2 won't download.

author: Mikko Käyhkö
comment: Doesn't install on LG G Watch R with Android Wear 1.4 (6.0.1)

author: Tom Zarycki
comment: I do like having a reminder every half hour or so to get up and move around.  I wish I could set a separate schedule for certain days of the week though.

author: Jason Sterling
comment: Will not send notifications to my watch for some reason. Any suggestions?
title: Moto 360 1st generation

author: Ja V
comment: Must start app on watch everytime. Plus runs on the background. Phone app should  enable reminder card when needed. Not have app running on watch constant.

author: Jiagang Zhang
comment: Had to remove it, since it tries to remind me to move during my sleep.

author: Mohammed Shafi Musthafa Ali
comment: Need an update! Need a Sleep time automatic disable option. Please do it ASAP.
title: Not bad but!

author: Chase G.
comment: Finally, thanks to this app, I can be alerted when I've been sitting too long, which is a common concern for me at my desk job. I'm using a Moto 360 and with this most recent update, it seems to work great. The interface is nice and clean and so far the app doesn't seem to be too much of a battery hog. Now when my smug Apple Watch friends ask if my 360 can tell me if I've been sitting too long, I can proudly say yes. Thanks to the developer for the great work, I've gladly purchased the premium version.
title: Works Great! Love it!

author: Mardo Atoyan
comment: Update 7/31/15 - works as intended now. I gave it about a week from last update and have had no issues. Thanks for fixing the bug. Back to 5 stars!!!!!.                                                      I really wanted to like this app. I loved it when it worked, but ever since the 5.1 update for wear and even with the latest update for this app to address the break, it can't detect movement and won't stop bugging me. Have had to turn it off. Feels like I wasted my money on the paid version.

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content: Sorry for the inconvenience, issue fixed in latest version (1.6)

title: Works great now after bug fix

author: Bo Stone
comment: This now works as intended on my Moto 360. Love the app and thanks to the dev for fixing it! Now all your one-star naysayers don't forget to update your reviews

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content: Sorry for the inconvenience, issue fixed in latest version (1.6)

author: David Carli-Arnold
comment: The app seems to once again be working on the moto 360, and is a very good and fully featured (for what the app aims to do) app... I was tempted to remove 1 star simply because it was so slow to update, but I am reviewing the app, not the developers... I hope updates are faster in the future...
title: Working again

author: Michael W
comment: Basically just a timer.  Sometimes it reminds me, sometimes it doesn't.
title: Doesn't seem to be aware of my movements

author: lhm92009 M
comment: I never get an alert/notification on either Moto 360 or LG Watch R with latest SW.  The app on the watch does track inactive time and it resets this time if I move - just not getting the alert/notification which is the point of the app.  Contacted developer but no response so far.

author: Edwin Shi
comment: I am not sure what happened to my moto 360, I have the android wear os 5.1.1. Can not get the alert on my watch, either by test or normal use.
title: not working

author: Daniel Turnbull
comment: Love it, great stuff. I get told to move whenever I sit for too long. This is good.

author: Dan Eldridge
comment: All issues fixed.  App works as advertised.  Very responsive developer.  Kudos!

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content: Sorry for the inconvenience, issue fixed in latest version (1.6)

author: Brent Graham
comment: Works great, shows nice motivating messages.

author: Scott Aniol
comment: Great app. Just what I need. Works perfectly.

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content: Sorry for the inconvenience, issue fixed in latest version (1.6)

title: Fantastic

author: Warren Jones
comment: Developer was quick to respond, however now that I'm able to use the application I found that it consumes battery resources more than similar motion detection Android Wear applications on the Play Store. Still, I applaud the dev for listening to the community feedback.

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content:
Thanks for feedback. Engine in hyperefficient mode is as efficient as possible, battery consumption is unnoticable (close to zero). 
The only measurable battery drain can come from the inactivity alerts. It it's an issue for you, choose standard notification instead of rich and animated "motivational quote".

title: Update fixed problems with the Moto 360...

author: John S
comment: So with newest version the notifications seem to work but it kills the battery life on my Asus Zen watch, battery normally lasts a full day, with this app my battery was dead before 6pm. Turned it off today and watch battery is fine. Going to turn it back on tomorrow and see if it uses battery life again
title: Works but destroys battery

author: Jim McIntyre
comment: I've had no issue with this app on my moto360. It's exactly what I'm looking for.
title: Just what I was looking for!

author: Tucker Sferro
comment: Doesn't work, even with latest update.... Paid for premium features unfortunately too

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content: Sorry for the inconvenience, issue fixed in latest version (1.6)

title: App will not stop turning itself on and can't be dismissed

author: Bryan Malecha
comment: The inactive counter was racking up thousands of hours in seconds.  Reset didn't reset.  The inactive alarm never worked.  This app needs attention.

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content: Sorry for the inconvenience, issue fixed in latest version (1.6)

title: Wouldn't track on 360/s5 combo

author: Peter Lechtaski
comment: Does  not detect steps and reset timer.

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content: Sorry for the inconvenience, issue fixed in latest version (1.6)

title: Not working on Moto 360

author: Java Junky
comment: Same issues as others have reported, it is not detecting movement and keeps pinging me even after I get up and walk around.  If the 360 doesn't offer a movement sensor, an easy fix would be to just reset the timer manually when the user acknowledges the notification on their watch.  I hope this can be improved because I really need this app as I am a developer as well and sit way to much.

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content: Sorry for the inconvenience, issue fixed in latest version (1.6)

title: Not working correctly on 360

author: Chris Fasnacht
comment: Can you please add the ability to skip a notification or set a time out? Some times, when in a work meeting, or in a theater it is not polite to stand up and it is annoying to continue getting alerts to stand up. Maybe integrating with calendar events would be nice. Otherwise the app is great!

author: Lawrence Micallef
comment: Keeps triggering even when on charge (LG G watch). Also no longer obeying phone "do not disturb" settings
title: Few glitches in latest build

author: Ted Weller
comment: Shows me being sedentary for 50+ hours even though I have been up moving around and taking walks. Fix this & it might be a good app.

reply.author: w9 software
reply.content: Sorry for the inconvenience, issue fixed in latest version (1.6)

title: MoveUp doesn't (move)

comment: I really like the idea of this app. I've used a different one, but it does not allow you to customize the idle alerts.  I have a Samsung Gear Live watch paired with an HTC One M7 phone. It doesn't seem to recognize when I have moved, even after taking several hundred steps. I try the test notification and the timer never seems to reset after I have walked around. If there is any information I can provide, I will be glad to do so as I would really love to use this app; especially since I have paid for it.
title: Not working with my Samsung Gear Live

author: Dan Rose
comment: Constantly getting 5 min reminder alarms even after I've moved a lot! A manual reset would be good for when this happens.
title: How much do I have to move?
